sdu.dsa.sensor
Class SensorUDPConnector

java.lang.Object
  sdu.dsa.sensor.SensorUDPConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISensorConnector
public class SensorUDPConnector
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISensorConnector

Implement the connection service for a sensor. When the connect method is triggered, the connector sends a handshake packet to the monitor specified in the constructor to warn it that it's available. If the monitor don't send any command after the HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT it will continue sending handshake packet until the first command is received. When a command is received, it's executed in a separated thread to continue listening to the monitor sending commands. If no command is received after the SILENCE_TIMEOUT it consider that the monitor may have lost the sensor so the handshake process starts again. When the connector disconnect, it sends a disconnect packet to the monitor. The disconnection of the connector can also be triggered by the monitor.

Version:
1.0
Author:
DSA-Project Group [Spring 2012]

Field Summary
static int HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT
          Contains the timeout used before re-sending a handshake packet to the monitor.
static int SILENCE_TIMEOUT
          Contains the timeout used before re-starting the handshake process if no data is asked by any monitor.
 
Constructor Summary
SensorUDPConnector(ISensor sensor, java.net.InetAddress monitorAddress, int monitorPort)
          Construct a SensorConnector which provide communication services with a monitor.
 
Method Summary
 void connect()
          Make the handshake with the monitor and makes available the data provider service for the monitor.
 void disconnect()
          Disconnect the sensor.
